hints.content:
To find the difference in lengths, we start with the length of the $\purpleD{\text{whale shark}}$ and subtract the length of the $\blueE{\text{giant squid}}$.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1223c302ce8fa1001a7d22e3ff3ec1138d51a3b7)

$\purpleD{61} \text { ft}-\blueE{39} \text { ft}= \maroonD{\Large\Box} \text{ ft}$

Let's subtract to find the difference.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ce5009c47f0d69b23272b352cbfb8df36ded42d6)

$\purpleD{61}\text{ ft}  - \blueE{39}\text{ ft}  = \maroonD{22}\text{ ft}$
The whale shark is $\maroonD{22}\text{ ft}$ longer than the giant squid.

question.content:
The lengths of different sea animals are listed below.

Animal | Length
- | - | -
Elephant seal | $22 \text { ft}$ 
Whale shark |  $61 \text { ft}$ 
Giant squid | $39 \text { ft}$ 

**What is the difference in the length between the whale shark and giant squid?**  

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 4]] $\text{ft}$
